page.title: 05The Old Graveyard-Kinoulton
page.content: Our class walked to the old graveyard. We went along Main Street and up Needham Hill, and,after passing a house called 'Kinross', we left the road and followed a bridle path to the site of the church of{St.Wilfrid. } I thought it was just an ordinary field until I caught sight of grave- stones.There is no trace of the actual church as it was pulled down in 1793 as it was in ruins then.However, gravestones are still standing, many of them in very good condition. They are made of{slate}and the inscriptions are clearly seen. The oldest gravestone that we could find had this inscription-{ {HERE LIES THE BODY OF ANNE,WIFE OF {HENRY CLARKE.SHE DIED AUGUST 1st 1692 {IN THE 37th YEAR OF HER AGE.
